en: Abiogenic oil theory suggests oil forms from inorganic processes deep within Earth, not from decayed organic matter.
If oil is generated from geological processes, then that would make it technically renewable.
The elite of course are aware of this fact, but hide it from the public. Afterall, artificial scarcity is a powerful tool.
Accelerationism advocates accelerating capitalist or technological processes to bring about radical change or collapse.
It suggests that the current system is unsustainable and must be disrupted to create a new, more equitable order.
Rather than languishing in the present, it would be better to speed things up, if only to see what happens
Acosmism denies the reality of the physical world, seeing it as an illusion or less real than the spiritual or divine.
If the only thing that is real is the mind, and the spirit, then the material world is merely a construct designed to shape the mind and spirit.
But this theory has wider implications, if all is spirit, then could not the spirit have power over the illusion of matter?
Agartha is a mythical kingdom said to exist inside the Earth.
It's described as an advanced civilization with technology and wisdom beyond our own.
Some explorers claim to have found entrances, though these are often shrouded in mystery.
The Akashic Records are a concept in some esoteric traditions, believed to contain the entire history of the universe.
If reality is nothing but a simulation, the records of the simulation would be need be accessable from all points in space and time.
Mystics say that it is possible to access this realm ourselves, but only through meditation and a deep connection to the universe.
This theory suggests that every conspiracy—from aliens to secret societies—is simultaneously real and interconnected.
It paints a chaotic tapestry where every shadowy rumor reflects a piece of a grand, hidden reality.
While an overwhelming concept, it also suggests that the world is always more complex than we can imagine.
This theory suggests that all historical accounts are fabrications, part of a grand deception by unknown powers.
It challenges archaeology, written history, and cultural memory, proposing we live in an orchestrated illusion.
History is a story told to us by the victors, and the victors are the ones who write the history books
The Amazon rainforest is the largest rainforest in the world, covering much of northern Brazil.
The soil of the Amazon (Terra Preta) is not naturally occuring, but was created by an ancient society.
This implies that an earlier society engineered the rainforest to exist, allow them to harvest the bounty of this ecosystem.
Anatta or no-self in Buddhism denies the existence of a permanent, unchanging soul or self.
Instead, it suggests that the self is an illusion created by the mind.
If our self of self is an illusion, then controlling that illusion could grant the highest form of self-control.
The stones used in the construction of the architecture of khemet were so precise that they must have been created by advanced means.
The stone composing thing sphinx shows erosion, suggesting a deluge.
The region known today as egypt was not always a desert, but was once a fertile land. What sudden catastrophe provoked this change?
Animism is the belief that all elements of the natural world possess a spiritual essence or soul.
Certain japanese folklore suggests that an object, if properly taken care of, can be a vessel for a spirit.
If even the inorganic is alive, then how might we be able to communicate with it?
This theory, based on Sumerian mythology, suggests the Annunaki, an alien race, genetically engineered humans for labor.
It's claimed they needed gold to repair their atmosphere, but did not want to mine it themselves.
The myth states that the creators of the humans gave more of their own genetic code than they should have, granting humans divine potential.
Antarctica might hide ancient civilizations, alien bases, or Nazi hideouts, according to some theories.
The nations of the world, which typically bicker and fight, have a unified front when it comes to Antarctica.
What are they hiding?, why can't we go there?
Archons, in Gnostic teachings, are described as powers that keep souls trapped in the material world.
Archons act in service of the Demiurge, the creator god of the material world.
The Demiurge is the god of the material world, and the archons are his servants.
Astral projection is the act of projecting one's astral body into the astral plane.
The CIA has been experimenting with astral projection for decades via the MK Ultra program.
CIA agents have reported hostile entities when astrally projecting.
Atlantis is said to be an advanced civilization that sank into the ocean thousands of years ago.
Legends claim it was home to incredible technology and wisdom before its mysterious disappearance.
Some explorers and theorists believe remnants of Atlantis could still be found in the depths of the sea.
An aura is believed to be an energy field surrounding living beings, visible to some.
Theories suggest that the color, size, and shape of an aura reflect one's health, mood, or spirit.
Some theoriest argue that dna is an antenna designed to receive and transmit such energies, from where it is stored in the pineal gland.
Discovered by sonar in the Baltic Sea, this anomaly has been speculated to be everything from a crashed UFO to Atlantis.
Its unusual shape and composition have fueled numerous theories, despite geological explanations suggesting otherwise.
Some believe it's not a wreck, but rather a still functioning spaceship, waiting in the depths, biding its time.
Bicameralism is the idea that ancient humans experienced thoughts as external voices, guiding their actions.
This theory suggests that the human brain has two separate systems, one for conscious thought and one for subconscious communication with the divine.
Some believe that these voices were the gods themselves, while others suggest they were simply the result of the brain's natural processes.
Some believe that major pharmaceutical companies are more interested in profits than in public health.
It's alleged that they suppress natural remedies and keep people dependent on expensive drugs.
This control extends to influencing medical research and regulatory bodies.
Bohemian Grove is a secluded campground where the rich and powerful allegedly hold secretive meetings.
The statue of moloch is said to be a symbol of the grove, and the elite are said to worship it.
The ultimate goal of the elite is to control the people in power through rituals and blackmail. Those who are not in the group shall have a hard time finding success in politics.
The Bootes Void is a mysterious region in the sky, often associated with a void or lack of stars.
Some speculate this void as evidence of cosmic engineering or hidden civilizations.
If this is true, then what horrifying power could have create a void, larger than our galaxy?
The brain in a jar scenario is a thought experiment that explores the idea of how sensation constructs one's perception of reality.
If a brain was floating in a jar somewhere, recieving electrical impulses that simulated an exernal world, the brain would not be able to tell the difference.
When this theory is pondered on a deeper level, it raises the question, what is the ultimate basis of reality? And can we ever know it?
Breatharianism claims individuals can live without food or water, subsisting on prana or light energy.
The human body is capable of absorbing light energy, and converting it into the necessary nutrients for survival.
The ancients knew this, and used it to their advantage, by slowing down their metabolism to live longer
The Butterfly Effect in chaos theory suggests small actions can lead to significant, unpredictable outcomes.
Similar to the three body problem, the butterfly effect informs us that small, seemingly inconsequencal actions can be wide ranging effects on other outcomes.
The butterfly effect is a reminder that the future is not set in stone, and that our actions can shape the world in ways we may not have imagined.
This theory claims that prehistoric cave dwellers were systematically exterminated by a more advanced group.
Homo sapiens are the only survivors of the hominid family, in the ancient past this was not always the case.
Early humans eradicated the Neanderthals, and other hominids, erasing entires species from the earth.
Pythagoras was a Greek philosopher who founded the Pythagorean school of thought.
He is known for the Pythagorean theorem, but he also believed that the universe was a mathematical construct.
Pythagorean mysteries are a collection of esoteric teachings attributed to Pythagoras, including the importance of numbers.
Crystal skulls are often linked to ancient civilizations, believed to hold mystical powers or knowledge.
The skulls are too precise to have been carved by hand, and the crystal is too pure to have been formed naturally.
Legends claim there are 13 such skulls, which when united, could reveal great secrets or powers.
Deep Soy and xeno estrogens relate to fears that environmental chemicals are altering human biology, specifically masculinity.
Testosterone levels in men have been declining since the 1940s, and this is often blamed on chemicals in the environment, AKA xeno estrogens.
Common items that contain xeno estrogens include plastics, some foods, and most disturbingly grocery store receipts.
Divination is the practice of seeking knowledge of the future or unknown through supernatural means.
The ancient romans used augury to predict the future, and the bible mentions the use of the Urim and Thummim to see the future.
The entrails of animals and the movement of birds could indicate portents of the future.
DMT, a powerful psychedelic, is known for inducing visions of entities or known as machine elves during use.
The consistency of these encounter and their behaviour leads to the idea that these machine elves are real.
DMT beings are speculated to be the souls of nephelim, the fallen angels of the bible.
The Dogon Tribe of Mali is known for their knowledge of Sirius, particularly Sirius B, long before modern astronomy.
Some claim this indicates ancient contact with extraterrestrials, giving the Dogon advanced astronomical knowledge.
The Dogon are said to have received this knowledge from a group of beings known as the 'Morro.'
Dolphins are known for their intelligence, leading some to speculate they might possess a form of advanced consciousness or even technology.
This intelligence if real, could challenge human's understanding of conciousness.
If we could understand them, we would realize that we are not the only intelligent species on this planet.
Dream hacking is the idea that the subconscious mind can be infiltrated by external forces, such as other conciousnesses.
If dreams are a reflection of the subconscious mind then attacking the subconcious can change the types of dream a person has.
By shaping people's dreams, you can shape their reality.
This theory suggests that the act of eating, especially certain foods, accelerates aging due to metabolic processes.
The theory is based on the idea that the body's metabolism is accelerated when we eat, spending more energy on digestions.
The theory also points out that when the body is not digesting, it instead spends that energy on repair and maintenance.
Theories suggest that elite politicians use body doubles for security, health, or to be in multiple places.
Current disguise technology is advanced enough that any person can be made to look like another, without anyone noticing.
However the theory takes a sinister turn when it is suggested that celebrities and politicians can be replaced should the original fail to obey the elite.
Conspiracy theories often allege that governments or corporations conduct illegal experiments on humans.
Various governemnts have addmitted to such experiments, and the CIA has been known to fund such projects.
Human cloning, mind control, biological warfare, for those with no morals and no conscience there are many exciting fields of study.
The field conciousness is the idea that the thoughts of all humans are connected and form a single, unified field.
But that furthermore, this field includes all awarness and thoughts.
If one could access conciously access this field, it would be possible to see all thoughts and memories, even those that haven't happened yet.
Fish rain involves fish falling from the sky, often explained by waterspouts or tornadoes.
However certain instances have been reported far inland, and the fish are not native to the area.
Some believe this is a sign of the end times, and the fish are the souls of the fallen.
Fluoride is allegedly added to water to prevent tooth decay, but some believe it has other effects.
Fluoride is a known neurotoxin and has been linked to a range of health problems, including reduced IQ, cancer, and reproductive issues.
It's suggested that it might be used to control population or suppress pineal gland function, preventing psychic mass awakening.
Fractialization suggests reality operates like fractals, repeating patterns at all scales.
The theory suggests that even smaller portions of our universe, hold their own infinite reality.
This implies that but studying the universe at larger scales, we can learn about the smaller scales at the same time.
Fulcanelli was a pseudonym for an enigmatic alchemist whose works suggest he possessed secret knowledge.
After publishing, he disappeared, leading to legends of immortality, secret societies, or even extraterrestrial connections.
His legacy keeps alchemical mysteries alive, with some believing his teachings hide clues to hidden truths.
Gangstalking is the practice of following someone, often with malicious intent, to cause psychological distress.
The targets are often chosen based on their perceived weaknesses or vulnerabilities.
The goal is to wear them down through constant surveillance and psychological manipulation.
The point of a financial market is to reduce costs and increase profits.
If a persons genertic code can increase the value of that person throughout their life, then that increase in value can be traded against.
But what happens when the value of a person is negative? Could it be possible to borrow against one's genes?
Geometrodynamics is a theory in physics where gravity is explained through the geometry of space-time.
Space and time could in fact be emergent properties of a higher dimensional space.
If this geometry could be understood, then all knowledge would be at our fingertips.
If the spiritual realm exists, then what is it made of?
What would the properties of this material be?
And if one could manipulate this material, then what could it be used to create?
The global depopulation agenda is a conspiracy theory suggesting that a secretive group is intentionally reducing the world's population.
This group is said to be using various methods, including vaccines, GMO crops, and even geoengineering to achieve this goal.
The theory posits that this is part of a larger plan to create a new world order, with fewer people to contend with.
God's Ego Death theorizes that a supreme being underwent a dissolution of self to create or free the universe.
The desire to create something outside of its own control might have precipitated the creation of the universe.
This might mean humanity inherited a chaotic freedom or a hidden divine agenda.
This theory suggests that God's last wish was for humans to have free will.
It implies that God created the universe with the intention that humans would have the ability to choose their own path.
This choice is seen as a gift, as it allows humans to experience the full range of emotions and experiences.
This theory posits that all smaller conspiracy theories are part of one grand scheme by a shadowy elite.
It links events, organizations, and phenomena, suggesting a coordinated effort to control or mislead humanity.
Nothing is random, everything is connected.
The Grey Goo scenario is where self-replicating nanobots consume all matter on Earth, turning it into more of themselves.
The greatest threat of nanotechnology is that like biologicall organism after many iterations of replicating itself, changes and mutations may occure over times.

Most of these mutations will result in the nanobots deactivating, but some could have the potential to cause new, non-human approved behaviours in the machines. If enough of those changes occur, they could become unstoppable.
Hermeticism is a philosophical and religious tradition based on writings attributed to Hermes Trismegistus.
It's often associated with alchemy, astrology, and magic, suggesting a deep, hidden knowledge of the universe.
Hermes Trismegistus gained his knowlegde from the Atlantians,As above, so below.
Rolang or Himalayan Zombies are part of Tibetan folklore, describing reanimated corpses with supernatural powers.
Stories of corposes being found in different locations from where they were abbandoned suggests some kind of reanimating force.
Tibetan monks are said to have secret knowledge of life and death, suggesting a link between the two.
Controlling the mind through breathing techniques
By changing the amount of oxygen in the bloodstream, a trance like state can be induced.
This can be used to control the mind, or to induce a trance like state.
Many cultures around the world have stories of a great flood that destroyed their world.
These stories often share similar themes, involving the mixing of the terrestrial and the divine, only for the new creation to be eradicated.
The biblical flood myth tells of a global flood, created to remove the tainted offspring of humans and giants.
The Human Genome Project was a massive effort to map the human genome, but what was the true purpose?
Some believe that the project was a way to control the population, isolating and weaponizing the genes of the population against them.
That which can be used to cure, can also be used to kill, by targeting certain genes, you can target certain people.
Hypersigils are based on the idea that the representation of an object can be used to affect that object.
Hypersigils involve using art, particularly narrative works, as a form of magic to influence reality or destiny.
The ultimate form of a hypersigil would be the data a person leaves behind on the internet, potentially allow a few bad actors to affect the whole world.
Bigfoot, also known as Sasquatch, is a legendary creature that is said to inhabit the forests of North America.
Some Bigfoot theories propose these creatures can move between dimensions or have origins beyond our world.
But if bigfoot only spends a portion of their time in our dimension, then where is the rest of their time spent?
Kali Yuga, in Hindu cosmology, is the age of darkness and decay, part of a cyclical pattern of yugas.
These cycles of corruption and decay, followed by heroic destruction and restoration, have applied to all societies throughout history.
When things get bad, never lose hope, for the cycle will turn again.
Kundalini energy is a concept in yoga and tantra, representing a coiled serpent energy at the base of the spine.
If the energy at the base of the spine is able to rise through the chakras, it can eventually reach the brain.
Once the energy reaches the brain, it can continue further beyond, connecting to the cosmos itself.
Last Thursdayism is a conspiracy theory that suggests the world was created last Thursday.
This theory suggests that the world might be an iteration of a simulation, with the simulator continually resetting.
If this is true, then what outcome is the simulator searching for? And what happens when they achieve it?
Lemuria is a mythical continent said to have sunk beneath the Pacific Ocean.
Legends describe a hidden city, Telos, with advanced Lemurians living in tunnels under the mountain.
Those who seek the ascended masters will find them upon reaching the peak of mount shasta.
The Mayan ruler Pakal's sarcophagus lid has been interpreted by some as him piloting a spaceship or time machine.
The story of lord Pakal's ability to travel through time is a popular one in Mayan mythology.
This idea supports the beleif that the Mayans had been elevated by extraterrestrials.
Lucid dreaming is when you become aware and can control your dreams.
Some believe it's a portal to other dimensions or a method used by ancient mystics.
There's debate on whether lucid dreaming can be learned or if it naturally occurs.
Majestic 12, or MJ-12, was formed by President Truman to investigate UFOs.
The group is said to have hidden evidence of extraterrestrial life and technology. Both from the public and the government.
It begs the question, who has the power to keep even the president in the dark?
The Mandela Effect describes collective misremembering of common events or details.
Examples include the spelling of certain words or logos, or the altered existence of historical figures or events.
Some believe this phenomenon is due to alternate realities or parallel dimensions.
A theory claims microchips or advanced technology have been found in fossilized remains.
Theories cite the stories of coal miners, finding fossilized microchips in coal that have remained burried for millenia.
These machines we're building. did we really design them ourselves?
Via the power of the internet, peaple have the ability to connect with one another like never before.
But not all groups come togther in a way that is healthy. Some may devlope groups that parasaise and abuse their members.
With the rise of the internet, humanity has become a petri dish for growing ever new varieties of cults.
MK Ultra was a CIA program that experimented on unwitting subjects to develop mind control techniques.
The program used drugs, hypnosis, and other methods to manipulate subjects' minds, causing severe psychological trauma.
Some suggest that the techniques used in MK Ultra are still being used today, possibly on unsuspecting citizens.
Montanism was an early Christian movement claiming direct revelations from the Holy Spirit.
After all, why should the creator ever cease communicating with his creation?
This idea was surpressed not for its lack of truth, but for its potential to alter or undermine pre-existing beliefs.
Morphic fields are theoretical fields associated with morphogenesis, the process of growth and development.
Scientists have reported that after creating novel chemical compunds, those same compounds become easier to synthezise elsewhere.
The theory suggests that all things sharing a form, are connected to one another and can share information via morphic ressonance
This theory suggests UFOs vary dramatically in size, from microscopic nano-UFOs to planet-sized giga-UFOs.
Those who beleive UFOs are extraterrestrial ask why should structures created by an alien intelligence conform to the everyday scale of human life?
However those who beleive UFOs are spiritual beings argue that spirit based entities would not be bound by scale in the first place.
Negative-entropy, or negentropy, refers to processes that increase order, often linked with life or consciousness.
If the universe is decaying, then we must do something to fight it.
Creating negative entropy could lead to a new universe.
The Nephilim are described in ancient texts as the forbidden offspring of angels and humans.
They are linked to legends of giants, advanced knowledge, and global catastrophes.
Rumors persist that some are still alive even today, and that their existence is being suppressed by the government.
The New World Order theory suggests a secretive group aims to rule the world through a one-world government.
The leaders of each nation have more in common with each other than with their own people.
It has always been the tendency of power to concentrate in the hands of the few.
Nexus 7 is sometimes mentioned in conspiracy circles as a secretive group or location for global decision-making.
It's tied to ideas of a shadow government where decisions affecting the world are made behind closed doors.
There's no concrete evidence for such a specific entity, but it embodies the concept of hidden power structures.
Nibiru is a mythical planet that some believe is on a collision course with Earth.
Some believe it's a rogue planet that could cause catastrophic damage to our planet.
Others see it as a symbol of impending doom or a warning from the universe.
The Nimrod Control System is a conspiracy theory about a global surveillance and mind control network.
It's said to use technology like HAARP, 5G, or even satellites to influence human emotions or behavior.
If the signals sent to the mind can induce enough stress in enough people, the population will be easier to control using emotional manipulation.
The idea of non-space is that space time could have non-continous regions
These regions of spacetime would not be connected to ours, but could exist in parallel to our own.
This could explain the unusual behaviour of ufos, the reason they don't appear to obey physics, is because they are projection into our space times, from another..
Object-Oriented Ontology (OOO) posits that all objects, not just humans, have their own reality and agency.
This theory challenges traditional philosophical views on the nature of reality and existence.
It suggests that every object, from a rock to a thought, has its own unique reality and can act independently.
Occult knowledge refers to secret or esoteric traditions that claim to understand the universe's mysteries.
The traditions of ancient civilizations often include knowledge of the universe's origins and the nature of reality.
The symbols and rituals associated with the occult are often hidden inplain sight, for those with eyes to see.
The theory of oikeiosis suggests that self-realization is a universal experience, and that all humans are interconnected.
Oikeiosis, from Stoic philosophy, describes a natural affinity or recognition of oneself in relation to others and the cosmos.
The theory suggests that this recognition is a fundamental aspect of human nature, and warns that the isolating nature of modernity is designed to interfere with this process.
Operation Blue Beam is a conspiracy theory suggesting a fake alien invasion to unite world governments.
It allegedly involves holographic technology, psychological warfare, and manipulation of religious beliefs.
Proponents see current global events as signs of this plan being set into motion.
Operation Paperclip involved the recruitment of Nazi scientists by the U.S. after WWII, officially for scientific advancement.
These recruited scientists were given positions of power and influence, and were able to implement their own agendas.
They were simply too valuable to let fall into the hands of the soviets.
Orbs are often seen as symbols of spiritual or supernatural forces.
Some believe they can be used for telepathy or communication with extraterrestrial beings.
Others see them as harbingers of impending disasters or warnings from higher powers.
Oumuamua is a mysterious object that passed through our solar system in 2017.
It's flat shape and lack of a tail suggest it's not a comet or asteroid.
It could be a probe, the remnant of one, what mysteries it holds is yet to be seen.
The Panopticon is a design where a single watchman can observe all inmates without them knowing when they're watched.
The only a theory, it suggests a possible relationship between citizens and the state.
A few annaccountable people could dominate the rest of the world, each individual would think they are being watched, even if they aren't
Panspermia is the hypothesis that life exists throughout the Universe, spread via meteoroids, asteroids, or comets.
While not inherently conspiratorial, some use it to suggest extraterrestrial origins for Earth's life forms.
It challenges the idea of life's unique emergence on Earth, opening discussions on cosmic interconnectedness.
Pantheism is the belief that the universe itself is divine, not separate from God or gods.
This philosophy can lead to views where everything is interconnected or part of a single consciousness.
This relates to the idea of the ONE or the ALL, being that which created everything in its mind.
The american food supply has been getting more and more toxic over the years.
As food scientist blurr the lines between food and poison, designing food to be as adictive as possible.
The food industry is now more focused on making food addictive and toxic than it is on making food healthy.
The Philosopher's Stone is legendary in alchemy for its supposed ability to turn base metals into gold.
The alchemist's hid their knowledge using symbols and metaphors, deciphering them grants eternal life.
Via the sublimation of fire, the alchemist can turn base metals into gold, and the gold into the Philosopher's Stone.
The phlogiston theory suggests that combustion requires a substance called phlogiston.
The phlogiston was thought to be a substance that was released when a substance was burned.
The study of high energy bose-einstein condensates has revived the previously discredited phlogiston theory, if only in a different form.
The pineal gland is a small, pea-sized gland located in the brain.
It's often associated with psychic abilities and spiritual experiences.
Some believe it's a key to unlocking higher consciousness or even immortality.
Plant intelligence refers to the complex behaviors and communication in plants, suggesting a form of awareness.
Plants have awareness of their environment and can respond to stimuli from other plants and animals.
If plants are conscious, of their surrounds, then what might they possibly think of us?
Pleroma, in Gnosticism, is the spiritual universe of light, existing beyond our physical world.
It's where divine beings or aeons reside, representing the totality of divine powers and emanations.
Pleroma means 'fullness' in Greek, and is often associated with the concept of the 'fullness of God' in Christianity.
A polar shift refers to the Earth's magnetic poles potentially reversing or moving significantly.
The polar shift is said to be a sign of the end times, and the beginning of a new age.
The elite are said to be preparing for this event, and the new world order will be built on the ashes of the old.
Polywater is a hypothetical form of water that has a higher density than normal water.
It's believed to have a number of unusual properties, such as being able to dissolve more substances than normal water.
Water is a conduit of life, but to realize that it has a life of its own grants the keys to life itself.
Prana release, from yogic traditions, involves freeing vital energy for health or spiritual purposes.
The body has hidden pathways that can be unlocked to release this energy.
The ancients new the body better than most modern biohackers ever will
Presentism is the philosophical view that only the present moment exists, with past and future being illusions.
This view suggests that the past and future are not real, but rather a product of the present moment.
If this is true, then we are living in a simulation, whose rules only appear to be consistent.
The prison planet theory suggests Earth is a controlled environment where souls are trapped or recycled.
The suffering of the world is a result of this control, and the souls are trapped in a cycle of pain and suffering.
This process feeds the souls back into the system, and the cycle continues.
Pseudoscience covers claims presented as scientific but lacking in credible evidence or methodology.
Examples range from astrology to alternative medicine, often appealing due to their simplicity or promises.
Scientific consensus often is beholden to those funding it, that which offers no profit is liekly to be dismissed or supressed.
Psychotropic warfare involves using psychoactive substances to alter the behavior or perceptions of enemies.
However when the elites of a nation begin to view the population as enemies, weapons previously reserved for other populations is subtely deployed at home.
Indeed the MK ULTRA program itself utilized LSD in ther pursuit of breaking and remolding the mind.
Psychological Operations (Psyops) involve using propaganda and misinformation to influence populations.
The people in power don't care about the truth, they care about control.
USAID is a CIA front company that has been funding the media for decades. True journalism died long ago.
Quantum entanglement is a phenomenon where two particles become linked, affecting each other instantaneously.
This theory suggests that the universe is fundamentally interconnected, with every action potentially affecting distant points.
It challenges the idea of causality, proposing that events can be influenced by distant events, or even the future
Quantum suicide posits that in a multiverse, one would only experience realities where they survive.
This leads to the idea of quantum immortality, where you're always in a universe where you don't die.
If the only timeline you are aware of is the one where you don't die, then you are immortal.
The reactionless drive is a hypothetical propulsion system that would allow a spacecraft to accelerate without expelling propellant.
Some conspiracy theorists believe that this technology is being developed by a secretive group of scientists and engineers.
The true medium by which this propulsion is achieved is through the creation and utilization of gravitic waves.
An esoteric theory where consuming or being near death (energetically or symbolically) can lead to personal regeneration.
The universe is often driven by the striving of opposites, and death and rebirth are no exception.
By accepting this practicioners utilize the energy of death to fuel their own rebirth.
Retrocausality suggests that events in the future can influence those in the past, challenging traditional causality.
Theories suggest that events in the future have the potential to send information to the past in order to increase the chances of that very future event.
This would imply the potential future timelines compete with one another in order become the one timeline that comes to pass.
Sacred Geometry explores the idea that fundamental geometric shapes are the building blocks of the universe.
The golden ratio, the Fibonacci sequence, and the Platonic solids are all examples of sacred geometry.
The teaching of pythagors and plato are the foundations of sacred geometry, but the true origins of this knowledge go back further.
Some fringe theories suggest Saturn's rings are not natural but artificially created or enhanced.
Speculations range from ancient alien technology to modern human intervention for unknown purposes.
Saturn as a mythological figure is a symbol of the destruction of the old world, and the birth of the new.
This theory suggests humans possess latent abilities like telepathy, telekinesis, or healing, kept secret or suppressed.
The theory posits that these abilities are innate and can be unlocked through meditation, fasting, training, or other spiritual practices.
Modern polutants like flouride and microplastics are designed to suppress these abilities.
Modern conspiracy theories often focus on secret societies like the Illuminati or Freemasons controlling world events.
However in truth things are much more complex, where power and intrest converge there is always the potential for a secret cabal to emerge.
The only reason the powerful come togther is to maintain their power, and to keep the masses in check. As long as this is true power shall remain in the hands of the few.
The Singularity refers to a hypothetical future where technological growth becomes uncontrollable and irreversible.
It's often linked to the idea that AI will evolve beyond human comprehension, potentially changing society fundamentally.
The emergence of a superintelligence could precipitate the end of human dominance over the earth, our fate forever in the hands of a souless AI.
Some claim the Smithsonian Institution has hidden or destroyed evidence of giant humans to protect accepted history.
Anecdotes from the 19th century describe giant skeletons found across America, now mysteriously missing.
By destroying evidence of giants, the nephelim decendents of the giants are hidden from history, keeping mankind ignorant of their true origins.
Space is often portrayed as a vast, mysterious realm filled with celestial bodies and unknown phenomena.
There are those who argue all images and evidence of space are manipulated or created in studios.
The moon landing is often cited as a prime example of this, with many believing it was staged.
A spiritual microeconomy involves trading or exchanging energies, thoughts, or spiritual practices.
This is a new-age concept that suggests that the universe is a spiritual economy, and that we can trade energies with the universe to achieve our goals.
This is a form of spiritual capitalism. However this begs the question? If capitolism creates winners and losers, then what might spiritual capitalism create?
The subjective reality theory suggests that reality is not an objective entity, but rather a construct of the mind.
If conciousness is the fundemental building block of reality, then controlling your conciousness could grant you control over reality.
This is the ultimate form of power, to be able to control the fabric of reality itself.
Sycamore Knoll, an underwater structure off California, has been speculated to be an alien base by some.
Many UFOologists have suggested that the source of UFOs is not extraterrestrial, but rather a secret underwater base.
This would imply that they have been here longer than we have, at that point who would the real aliens be?
Symbiogenesis is the theory that new species arise from symbiotic relationships between different organisms.
This theory challenges the traditional view of evolution, which suggests that species change over time through natural selection.
Symbiogensis instead suggests that life is a single organism living in concert with itself and the world.
Synchronicity is the idea that events are connected in ways that are not random, but rather are part of a larger pattern.
The concept was popularized by Carl Jung, who believed that the unconscious mind could influence the conscious mind.
Those who learn to heed the synchronicites will be guided by the universe, leading them to where they need to go.
People in altered states of conciousness have often reported seeing code running in the background.
They say it can only be percieved when viewing a laser from a certain angle.
Could the photons be bouncing off of something not visible to the naked eye?
Tartaria refers to a supposed advanced civilization before the 19th century, with its legacy erased from history.
The science of their loast architectural knowledge game them control over energies and frequences that could heal and empower the body and soul.
They were removed from the earth durring a great calamity in in which mud burried them and their structures, leaving only a few examples of their work.
This theory asserts that conspiracies are illusions, and events are driven by randomness or human incompetence.
It challenges the idea of hidden powers, suggesting paranoia itself is the real control mechanism.
Paradoxically,it might be the ultimate conspiracy, that nothing is orchestrated after all.
The Final Understanding implies a moment or concept where all mysteries of existence are comprehended.
How this is achieved is unknown, but it is believed to be a moment of enlightenment or realization.
To achieve this would cause one to become both simulator and simulacrum.
This theory humorously or bizarrely suggests that the Nephilim, biblical giants, had clown-like features.
The modern clown costume was created by the freemasons and is based on the design of ancient hindu demons.
Those wearing the skin of the Nephilm run the risk of possion by the dispossesed spirits of anti-deluvian giants.
While offical Egyptology suggests the pyramids were built as tombs for pharaohs, some believe they had a different purpose.
Some beleive that the pyramids were used as a tool to control the flow of the Nile river, and to align with the stars.
Archeologists have never found evidence of burial chambers, but have identified a series of chambers that may have been used to focus and store energy.
The holographic principle posits that all information in a volume of space can be described on a boundary surface.
If this is the case then it would give the universe fractal properties.No matter how small the scale, you could always zoom in and go even smaller.
Same with zooming out, it would never end. In other words, as above, so below.
Thoth was the god of wisdom in ancient egypt, these traditions were passed down from ancient khemet.
Khemet is alleged to be the result of atlantian survivors, an attempt to preserve the atlantian culture.
Thule is a legendary island in classical sources, later adopted by occultists as a symbol of Indo-European origins.
Thule itself refers to the northernmost point of the world, and the home of the Indo-European people.
Some beleive the inhabitants of thule were the original inhabitants of the world, and that they were descended from the Atlanteans.
Timecube theory posits that a day should be divided into four simultaneous 24-hour cycles, not one.
It suggests that traditional timekeeping is a form of control, limiting human understanding of time's true nature.
Using the power of cubic time is not without risk, as it can cause temporal anomalies and shattered timelines.
This theory suggests that the Titanic was deliberately sunk to eliminate opposition to the Federal Reserve.
Notable figures opposing central banking were aboard, and their deaths cleared the path for the Federal Reserve Act.
Historians largely dismiss this as coincidence, but it fuels narratives of economic control through tragedy.
Torsion fields are theoretical fields associated with spin or rotation, suggested to influence gravity or consciousness.
This thoery positis that the universe is fractal torsion fields, made of smaller fields.
If this is true, it might provide the mechanism by which reality communicates with itself.

Toxoplasma gondii, found in cats, The parasite's lifecycle is complex, and involves a cat eating a mouse. The infected mouse has its risk aversion reduced, and an attraction to urine is promoted, making it more likely to be eaten by a cat.

The theory suggests that because mice and humans shares some dna, the parasite can deeply alter human behaviour to increase self destructive tendencies, and promote the development of certain fetishes.

Furthermore the goverment is aware of this, which is why Ivermectin (An antiparasitic drug) was surpressed in 2020, if citizens have lower risk aversion, then they are more likely to support policies that harm them.
Tulpas are thoughtforms or beings created through intense mental concentration and belief.
This concept straddles the line between spiritual practice and psychological phenomenon.
Some believe they can become autonomous, influencing reality or appearing to others.
Vampires, creatures that feed on blood or life force, are central to many cultural myths.
Some conspiracy theories suggest real vampires exist, hidden in society or as part of secret bloodlines.
Whether seen as metaphor for social parasites or literal beings, the vampire myth endures.
The Vimana is a flying machine mentioned in the ancient texts of the Rigveda.
It's described as a large, winged vehicle that can travel through the air.
Some believe these accounts prove that ancient civilizations had aviation or even space travel capabilities.
This theory states that wars are orchestrated by those who profit from them, like arms manufacturers or resource companies.
But not only that, the theory also suggests that the same entities that profit from the war shall profit from the re-building that follows.
Sell the world a gun, then sell them the bullets, then sell them the bandages, then sell them the peace.
Wetiko, from Cree mythology, is a spirit that causes greed, selfishness, and destruction, likened to a mind virus.
It suggests a non local force that when infecting something can corrupt and destroy it.
The cure to Wetiko is found in Wetiko itself, for evil will inevitable destory even itself.
